title: rclone sync will not delete symbolic links in dest without --link

#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`



#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

[rclone sync documentation](https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_sync/) says:

> Destination is updated to match source, including deleting files if necessary (except duplicate objects, see below).

But it will not delete symbolic links in destination

It will delete links if you specify "--link" (but that of course enables .rclonelink behavior).

If intentional, I think this behavior should be documented in the rclone sync docs.

### Showing the problem

Starting with:
```
% ls -lr src dest
src:
total 4
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user 3 Aug 13 01:24 hi.txt

dest:
total 4
lrwxrwxrwx 1 user user 7 Aug 13 15:32 link -> bye.txt
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user 3 Aug 13 01:24 bye.txt

```

Run sync:

```
% rclone -vv sync src dest
2025/08/13 15:41:38 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.53.3-DEV" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "sync" "src" "dest"]
2025/08/13 15:41:38 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "src"
2025/08/13 15:41:38 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/user/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2025/08/13 15:41:38 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item "src" to be canonical "/home/user/try/rclone/src"
2025/08/13 15:41:38 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "dest"
2025/08/13 15:41:38 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item "dest" to be canonical "/home/user/try/rclone/dest"
2025/08/13 15:41:38 NOTICE: link: Can't follow symlink without -L/--copy-links
2025/08/13 15:41:38 DEBUG : Local file system at /home/user/try/rclone/dest: Waiting for checks to finish
2025/08/13 15:41:38 DEBUG : Local file system at /home/user/try/rclone/dest: Waiting for transfers to finish
2025/08/13 15:41:38 DEBUG : hi.txt: MD5 = 764efa883dda1e11db47671c4a3bbd9e OK
2025/08/13 15:41:38 INFO  : hi.txt: Copied (new)
2025/08/13 15:41:38 DEBUG : Waiting for deletions to finish
2025/08/13 15:41:38 INFO  : bye.txt: Deleted
2025/08/13 15:41:38 INFO  :
Transferred:   	         3 / 3 Bytes, 100%, 792 Bytes/s, ETA 0s
Checks:                 1 / 1, 100%
Deleted:                1
Transferred:            1 / 1, 100%
Elapsed time:         0.0s

2025/08/13 15:41:38 DEBUG : 2 go routines active

```

symlink is still there, even though rest of deletion happened
Worse, the link is now dangling.

```
% ls -lr src dest
src:
total 4
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user 3 Aug 13 01:24 hi.txt

dest:
total 4
lrwxrwxrwx 1 user user 7 Aug 13 15:32 link -> bye.txt
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user 3 Aug 13 01:24 hi.txt

```

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

```
% rclone version
rclone v1.53.3-DEV
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.18.1
```


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

Ubuntu 22.04 ; Linux kernel 6.8.0-45-generic. 64-bit.

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

You can replicate this locally, as above; found issue in production with B2 backend.

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

% rclone -vv sync src dest
(See above.)

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

See above.
